name: Anthropology
descriptions: The Anthropology minor provides a broad understanding of human diversity across cultures, time periods, and biological variation. Students choose from four subfields: physical anthropology, cultural anthropology, archaeology, and linguistics.
The minor pairs well with any major for students interested in understanding human behavior, cultural systems, and global perspectives.

courses: Two of the following four introductory courses:
ANTH 20613 - Introduction to Physical Anthropology - 3 hrs.
ANTH 20623 - Introduction to Cultural Anthropology - 3 hrs.
